intro: Polygonum balansae subsp. balansae, commonly known as the Balansae knotweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. The plant features upright stems with heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in spikes, and produce tiny, three-lobed seeds. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
